intro: Anaxeton lundgrenii, commonly known as the purple sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Anaxeton lundgrenii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
